intro.subHeadline: Senior Front End Developer | Boston, MA
intro.introText: I'm Chris Roberts, an experienced front end developer in the Greater Boston area. I have 10+ years of experience and am well versed with HTML, CSS/SASS, PHP, and JavaScript.

entries.title: Senior Front End Developer
details: Developed custom WordPress websites for large scale and enterprise clients, consistently improving site performance and increasing overall site traffic
Built custom WP REST API endpoints to pull data into custom Vue.js, and React front end UIs
Deeply customized and extended WordPress CMS' capabilities using Advanced Custom Fields (ACF), custom post types, and taxonomies

Spearheaded development of our internal WordPress framework incorporating modern build tools (Parcel JS, Browser Sync, linting) greatly simplifying and shortening project development time resulting in increased company revenue
Collaborated with project managers to assess and document project guidelines and timelines
Mentored, assisted, and reviewed code for a team of eight developers.

entries.title: Front End Developer
details: Designed and developed our style guide to ensure high graphic standards and design consistency across our applications
Refactored CSS in our codebase, incorporating SASS, mixins, native CSS variables, and removing unused code
Worked on client side of web applications utilizing HTML, Ruby on Rails, CSS/SASS, Bootstrap, Vue.js, and React
Created reusable components for applications and utilized Vuex to pass data for deeply nested components
Worked as part of a distributed team, collaborating across the globe with our back end developers

entries.title: Web Designer & Developer
details: Developed custom websites for a variety of clients (from small business to enterprise) utilizing WordPress, custom post types, and Advanced Custom Fields (ACF)
Collaborated with the marketing team to implement SEO, develop custom landing pages, and forms with consistently high conversion rates
Improved client website performance by compressing images, minifying code, caching content, migrating to CDNs, and optimizing databases
